template.template: SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System
template.name: SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System

item.name: Zabbix Agent Ping
item.description: SCOM MP has no provisions to detect system down, this is a workaround.

trigger.name: Zabbix Agent Unreachable
trigger.description: Trigger set to 10 minutes. This reduces noise when restarting while .Net libraries need to be compiled.

item.name: Service or Driver Failed to Start

trigger.name: Service or driver failed to start
trigger.description: https://systemcenter.wiki/?GetElement=Microsoft.Windows.Server.10.0.OperatingSystem.ServiceOrDriverFailedToStart.Alert&Type=Rule&ManagementPack=Microsoft.Windows.Server.2016.Monitoring&Version=10.0.17.0 This trigger can be noisy if you have autoloading drivers with no hardware attached, such as "cdrom". Please set such drivers to autoload instead of boot critical.

item.name: Service has Entered into an Unpredictable State
Windows BugCheck Restart Events
item.description:
https://systemcenter.wiki/?GetElement=Microsoft.Windows.Server.10.0.OperatingSystem.RebootFromBugCheck.Collection&Type=Rule&ManagementPack=Microsoft.Windows.Server.2016.Monitoring&Version=10.0.8.0
For some strange reason Agent doesn't see these events (eventlog[System,,,BugCheck,1000|1001,,]) so must check with PS. Maybe agent doesn't check for events before agent was started...?

item.name: Storport Miniport Driver Timed Out Monitor

trigger.name: Windows Storport Miniport Driver has timed out a request
trigger.description: The Windows Storport Miniport Driver has timed out a request on the server {HOST.NAME}

item.name: Windows Dirty Shutdown Events
item.description:
https://systemcenter.wiki/?GetElement=Microsoft.Windows.Server.10.0.OperatingSystem.DirtyShutdown.Collection&Type=Rule&ManagementPack=Microsoft.Windows.Server.2016.Monitoring&Version=10.0.8.0
Agent doesn't see these events (eventlog[System,,,EventLog,6008,,]) for some reason so query PS manually

item.name: Too many requests for performance counter data have failed

trigger.name: Too many requests for performance counter data have timed out

item.name: Duplicate IP Address has been Detected
Checking File System Occurred on Startup
Network Adapter was Disconnected from the Network

trigger.name: Available Megabytes of Memory is too low
Total DPC Time Percentage is too high
Total Percentage Interrupt Time is too high

item.name: Percentage of Committed Memory in Use

trigger.name: Percentage of Committed Memory in Use is too high
Free System Page Table Entries is too Low
Memory Pages Per Second is too High

item.name: Max Concurrent API Semaphore Timeouts Monitor
Max Concurrent API Semaphore Waiters Monitor

trigger.name: TCPv4 Segments Received Per Second is too high
trigger.description: The threshold for the TCPv4\Segments Received/sec performance counter has been exceeded

trigger.name: TCPv4 Segments Retransmitted Per Second is too high
trigger.description: The threshold for the TCPv4\Segments Retransmitted/sec performance counter has been exceeded.

trigger.name: TCPv4 Segments Sent Per Second is too high
trigger.description: The threshold for the TCPv4\Segments Sent/sec performance counter has been exceeded.

trigger.name: TCPv6 Segments Received Per Second
trigger.description: The threshold for the TCPv6\Segments Received/sec performance counter has been exceeded.

trigger.name: TCPv6 Segments Retransmitted Per Second is too high
trigger.description: The threshold for the TCPv6\Segments Retransmitted/sec performance counter has been exceeded.

trigger.name: TCPv6 Segments Sent Per Second is too high
trigger.description: The threshold for the TCPv6\Segments Sent/sec performance counter has been exceeded.

item.name: Computer Browser Service Start Type
item.description: Helper to determine service start mode as most server OS have Browser set to disabled.

item.name: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Service Health
Windows Defender Antivirus Network Inspection Service Health

trigger.name: Windows Remote Management Service Stopped
trigger.description: https://systemcenter.wiki/?GetElement=Microsoft.Windows.Server.10.0.OperatingSystem.WindowsRemoteManagementServiceHealth&Type=UnitMonitor&ManagementPack=Microsoft.Windows.Server.2016.Monitoring&Version=10.0.17.0 As this service is delay-start and requires .Net recompilations during updates, allow 10 minutes for restart.

item.name: Restart Pending Component Based Servicing
item.key: system.run["cmd /v:on /c reg query \"HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Component Based Servicing\RebootPending\" ^>nul 2^>^&1 ^& echo !errorlevel!"]

item.name: Restart Pending File Rename Operations
item.key: system.run["cmd /v:on /c reg query \"HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\" /v PendingFileRenameOperations ^>nul 2^>^&1 ^& echo !errorlevel!"]

item.name: PowerShell Version Check
item.description: Check for required PowerShell version, we need at least PowerShell/WMF 3.0.

trigger.name: Upgrade PowerShell to at least WMF3.0
trigger.description: Some checks and discoveries do not work with less than PowerShell/WMF 3.0.

item.name: Windows Server Operating System BPA Monitor

trigger.name: Operating System is not compliant with Best Practices Analyzer

item.name: System information
item.description: Just to get basic OS telemetry

item.name: Windows Activation
item.key: wmi.get[root\cimv2,select licensestatus from softwarelicensingproduct where applicationID='55c92734-d682-4d71-983e-d6ec3f16059f' and licensestatus=1]

item.name: Number of Logical Processors
item.description: Helper for CPU usage trigger. Don't use builtin item as it might be used elsewhere.

item.name: Total Physical Memory
item.description: Helper for Percent Memory Used. TotalPhysicalMemory should return OS usable memory (eg it already excludes BIOS reserved memory etc).

discovery_rule.name: Windows Server Logical Disk
discovery_rule.key: wmi.getall[root\cimv2,SELECT * FROM Win32_Volume WHERE NOT Name LIKE '\\\\?\\Volume{%' AND (DriveType=3 OR DriveType=6)]
discovery_rule.description: Uses Win32_Volume for discovery as LogicalDisk doesn't have enough information. Skips volumes without mount point, such as boot volume as it's very hard to map it to correct PerfMon path (HardDiskVolume) - these volumes are usually boot or recovery ones and their performance doesn't matter. Preprocessing fixes JSON syntax (double escaping backslashes) https://systemcenter.wiki/?GetElement=Microsoft.Windows.Server.10.0.LogicalDisk&Type=ClassType&ManagementPack=Microsoft.Windows.Server.2016.Discovery&Version=10.0.8.0

Logical Disk Free Space (MB) {#I}
item_prototype.description: Item needs to be INT with no aggeration as float overflows with 1TB+ https://systemcenter.wiki/?GetElement=Microsoft.Windows.Server.10.0.LogicalDisk.MBFreeSpace&Type=UnitMonitor&ManagementPack=Microsoft.Windows.Server.2016.Monitoring&Version=10.0.17.0

trigger_prototype.name: Logical Disk Free Space in MBytes is low {#I}
Logical Disk Free Space in MBytes is low {#I}

item_prototype.name: Logical Disk Split I/O Per Second {#I}
Defragmentation Thin Provisioning {#I}
item_prototype.key: system.run["for /f \"tokens=3\" %a in ('reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Dfrg\Statistics\Volume{#DEVICEIDGUID} /v HardwareIssue') do echo %a"]

item_prototype.name: Defragmentation Fragmentation {#I}
item_prototype.key: system.run["for /f \"tokens=3\" %a in ('reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Dfrg\Statistics\Volume{#DEVICEIDGUID} /v LastRunPercentFragmentation') do echo %a"]

item_prototype.name: Logical Disk System Drive {#I}
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\cimv2,Select BootVolume From Win32_Volume Where Name='{#NAME}']

item_prototype.name: Logical Disk Size {#I}
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\cimv2,Select Capacity From Win32_Volume Where Name='{#NAME}']

item_prototype.name: File system error or corruption {#I}
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\cimv2,Select DirtyBitSet From Win32_Volume Where Name='{#NAME}']

trigger_prototype.name: File system error or corruption {#I}
trigger_prototype.description: NTFS reported the logical disk is in error or corrupt. NTFS on the logical disk {#I} has reported that some portion of the file system is in error or is corrupted. This dirty bit has been set for the logical disk. In most cases running the CHKDSK utility will address the problem. Refer to the product knowledge for more complete guidance.

trigger_prototype.expression: ( {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:system.run["for /f \"tokens=3\" %a in ('reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Dfrg\Statistics\Volume{#DEVICEIDGUID} /v HardwareIssue') do echo %a"].last()} <> 0 and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:system.run["for /f \"tokens=3\" %a in ('reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Dfrg\Statistics\Volume{#DEVICEIDGUID} /v HardwareIssue') do echo %a"].last()} <> 4 and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:system.run["for /f \"tokens=3\" %a in ('reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Dfrg\Statistics\Volume{#DEVICEIDGUID} /v LastRunPercentFragmentation') do echo %a"].last()} > {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FPERCFRAG_TH} ) or ( ( {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:system.run["for /f \"tokens=3\" %a in ('reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Dfrg\Statistics\Volume{#DEVICEIDGUID} /v HardwareIssue') do echo %a"].last()}=0 or {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:system.run["for /f \"tokens=3\" %a in ('reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Dfrg\Statistics\Volume{#DEVICEIDGUID} /v HardwareIssue') do echo %a"].last()}=4 ) and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:system.run["for /f \"tokens=3\" %a in ('reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Dfrg\Statistics\Volume{#DEVICEIDGUID} /v LastRunPercentFragmentation') do echo %a"].last()} < {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FPERCTHE_TH} and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:system.run["for /f \"tokens=3\" %a in ('reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Dfrg\Statistics\Volume{#DEVICEIDGUID} /v LastRunPercentFragmentation') do echo %a"].last()}<>0 )
trigger_prototype.name: Logical Disk Fragmentation Level is high {#I}

trigger_prototype.expression: ({SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\LogicalDisk({#I})\% Free Space",900].last()}<{$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEPER_ERR_TH} and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\LogicalDisk({#I})\Free Megabytes"].last()}<{$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEMB_ERR_TH})
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\LogicalDisk({#I})\% Free Space",900].last()}>({$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEPER_ERR_TH}*{$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEMB_ERR_RE}) and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\LogicalDisk({#I})\Free Megabytes"].last()}>({$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEMB_ERR_TH}*{$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEMB_ERR_RE}))
trigger_prototype.name: Logical Disk Free Space is low {#I}
trigger_prototype.description: https://systemcenter.wiki/?GetElement=Microsoft.Windows.Server.10.0.Legacy.LogicalDisk.FreeSpace.Monitor&Type=UnitMonitor&ManagementPack=Microsoft.Windows.Server.2016.Monitoring&Version=10.0.17.0 Unlike original check, all disks are considered the same.

trigger_prototype.expression: ( {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:wmi.get[root\cimv2,Select BootVolume From Win32_Volume Where Name='{#NAME}'].last()}=1 and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\LogicalDisk({#I})\Free Megabytes"].last()} < ( {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEMB_SYS_ERR_TH} + ( {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEMB_SYS_ERR_SMP} * {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:wmi.get[root\cimv2,Select Capacity From Win32_Volume Where Name='{#NAME}'].last()} ) ) and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\LogicalDisk({#I})\% Free Space",900].last()} < {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEPR_SYS_ERR_TH} ) or ( {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:wmi.get[root\cimv2,Select BootVolume From Win32_Volume Where Name='{#NAME}'].last()}=0 and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\LogicalDisk({#I})\Free Megabytes"].last()} < ( {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEMB_NSYS_ERR_TH} + ( {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEMB_NSYS_ERR_SMP} * {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:wmi.get[root\cimv2,Select Capacity From Win32_Volume Where Name='{#NAME}'].last()} ) ) and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\LogicalDisk({#I})\% Free Space",900].last()} < {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEPR_NSYS_ERR_TH} )
trigger_prototype.name: Logical Disk Free Space is low {#I}
trigger_prototype.description: https://systemcenter.wiki/?GetElement=Microsoft.Windows.Server.10.0.Legacy.LogicalDisk.FreeSpace.Monitor&Type=UnitMonitor&ManagementPack=Microsoft.Windows.Server.2016.Monitoring&Version=10.1.0.0 Unlike original trigger, a percentage of drive size (2.5 or 5) is added to MB threshold to make it more dynamic. Smaller disks will have relatively large MB threshold (at about 40GB, percent and MB will be equal at 10%/4GB), while large disk will have smaller MB thresholds, approaching percentage of drive size (2.5 or 5).

trigger_prototype.expression: ( {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:wmi.get[root\cimv2,Select BootVolume From Win32_Volume Where Name='{#NAME}'].last()}=1 and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\LogicalDisk({#I})\Free Megabytes"].last()} < ( {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEMB_SYS_WAR_TH} + ( {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEMB_SYS_WAR_SMP} * {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:wmi.get[root\cimv2,Select Capacity From Win32_Volume Where Name='{#NAME}'].last()} ) ) and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\LogicalDisk({#I})\% Free Space",900].last()} < {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEPR_SYS_WAR_TH} ) or ( {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:wmi.get[root\cimv2,Select BootVolume From Win32_Volume Where Name='{#NAME}'].last()}=0 and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\LogicalDisk({#I})\Free Megabytes"].last()} < ( {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEMB_NSYS_WAR_TH} + ( {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEMB_NSYS_WAR_SMP} * {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:wmi.get[root\cimv2,Select Capacity From Win32_Volume Where Name='{#NAME}'].last()} ) ) and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\LogicalDisk({#I})\% Free Space",900].last()} < {$SCOMMPWSOS_LDISK_FREEPR_NSYS_WAR_TH} )
trigger_prototype.name: Logical Disk Free Space is low {#I}
trigger_prototype.description: https://systemcenter.wiki/?GetElement=Microsoft.Windows.Server.10.0.Legacy.LogicalDisk.FreeSpace.Monitor&Type=UnitMonitor&ManagementPack=Microsoft.Windows.Server.2016.Monitoring&Version=10.1.0.0 Unlike original trigger, a percentage of drive size (2.5 or 5) is added to MB threshold to make it more dynamic. Smaller disks will have relatively large MB threshold (at about 40GB, percent and MB will be equal at 10%/4GB), while large disk will have smaller MB thresholds, approaching percentage of drive size (2.5 or 5).

discovery_rule.name: Windows Server Network Adapter
discovery_rule.key: wmi.getall[root\StandardCimv2,select interfacedescription from msft_netadapter where hardwareinterface = 'true']
discovery_rule.description:
Default instances have many nonexistent adapters, causing unnecessary hits. We can't use Name directly as some characters are replaced for performance counter instance names. For example '#' becomes '_'.
Does not work on earlier than WS2012

macro.description: Logical Disk Average Disk Seconds per Read Trigger Number of samples - 15 samples * 1m frequency = 15 minutes

Logical Disk Average Disk Seconds per Transfer Trigger Recovery multiplier
Logical Disk Average Disk Seconds per Transfer Trigger Threshold - 0.04 minutes = 40ms

trigger.expression: ({SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:service.info[Browser].last()}<>0 and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:service.info[Browser,startup].last()}<2)
trigger.name: Computer Browser Service Stopped

trigger.expression: {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:eventlog[System,,,EventLog,6008,,skip].nodata(24h)}=0 or {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:eventlog[System,,,BugCheck,1000|1001,,skip].nodata(24h)}=0
trigger.name: Dirty shutdown
trigger.description: Custom trigger to catch unexpected restarts.

trigger.expression: ({SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\Netlogon(_Total)\Semaphore Timeouts",900].last()}>{$SCOMMPWSOS_OS_MAXCAPITO_TH} or {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\Netlogon(_Total)\Semaphore Waiters",900].last()}>{$SCOMMPWSOS_OS_MAXCAPIW_TH})
trigger.recovery_expression: ({SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\Netlogon(_Total)\Semaphore Timeouts",900].last()}>({$SCOMMPWSOS_OS_MAXCAPITO_TH}/{$SCOMMPWSOS_OS_MAXCAPITO_RE}) or {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\Netlogon(_Total)\Semaphore Waiters",900].last()}>({$SCOMMPWSOS_OS_MAXCAPIW_TH}/{$SCOMMPWSOS_OS_MAXCAPIW_RE}))
trigger.name: Max Concurrent API Reached alert

trigger.expression: {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:system.run["cmd /v:on /c reg query \"HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Component Based Servicing\RebootPending\" ^>nul 2^>^&1 ^& echo !errorlevel!"].last()}=0 or {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:system.run["cmd /v:on /c reg query \"HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\WindowsUpdate\Auto Update\RebootRequired\" ^>nul 2^>^&1 ^& echo !errorlevel!"].last()}=0
trigger.name: Restart pending

trigger.expression: {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time",120].min(30m)}>95 and {SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:perf_counter_en["\System\Processor Queue Length",120].min(30m)}>({SCOM MP Windows Server Operating System:wmi.get[root\cimv2,Select NumberOfLogicalProcessors from Win32_ComputerSystem].last()}*15)
trigger.name: Total CPU Utilization Percentage is too high
trigger.description: https://systemcenter.wiki/?GetElement=Microsoft.Windows.Server.10.0.OperatingSystem.TotalCPUUtilization&Type=UnitMonitor&ManagementPack=Microsoft.Windows.Server.2016.Monitoring&Version=10.0.17.0 To understand this trigger, please read https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/kevinholman/2017/05/13/how-does-cpu-monitoring-work-in-the-windows-server-2016-management-pack/
